items.summary_title: What does Bila Tserkva look like after the Russian drone attack: photos from the State Emergency Service
items.summary: In the early hours of September 2, Russian forces launched a drone attack on Bila Tserkva community in Kyiv region. The strike caused a fire, resulted in one death, and left others injured. The body of a man was found during the extinguishing of a fire at a garage cooperative. Damage includes broken windows in multi-story buildings and fires affecting garages, commercial, and industrial premises. Local authorities warned residents about possible smoke in some areas and advised keeping windows closed.

items.summary_title: Corruption in drone procurement: an 8 million hryvnia bail was posted for "Servant of the People" member Kuznetsov
items.summary: For Ukrainian MP Oleksiy Kuznetsov, implicated in a corruption case involving the procurement of electronic warfare systems and drones, an eight million hryvnia bail was posted on September 1, as confirmed by the spokesperson of the High Anti-Corruption Court, Olesya Chemeris.

items.summary_title: The United Kingdom extends the protection program for Ukrainians by two years.
items.summary: The United Kingdom has extended the Ukraine Permission Extension (UPE) program by 24 months, allowing Ukrainian citizens and their families with existing visa statuses under various Ukrainian schemes to legally remain in the UK for an additional 18 months. Announced by Home Secretary Yvette Cooper on September 1, the extension aims to continue support for Ukrainians fleeing conflict. The application process is free, grants rights to work, housing, benefits, and education, and is available online starting February 4, 2025. The UK also emphasizes its commitment to aiding refugees from Syria and Hong Kong.

items.summary_title: Kostyuk was defeated by Mukhova after a 3-hour match at the US Open: how the battle unfolded
items.summary: Ukrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk was defeated by Czech top seed Karolína Muchová in the US Open round of 16 after a three-hour match. Muchová won the first set 6-3, Kostyuk claimed the second set in a tiebreak, and Muchová secured the final set 6-3. With this result, no Ukrainian players remain in the singles draw at the tournament. The final score was Kostyuk 3-6, 7-6, 3-6 Muchová.

items.summary_title: New Ukrainian Flamingo Cruise Missile Scores Hits on Russian Secret Service Base in Crimea
items.summary: Ukraine reportedly used its domestically produced Flamingo cruise missile for the first time in an attack on a Russian FSB border post near Armyansk in annexed Crimea. The missile, unveiled in August with a range of up to 3,000 km and a warhead exceeding one ton, was launched on August 31 as shown in videos from Ukrainian sources. While some reports attribute the strike to Neptune missiles, Ukrainian military outlets claim Flamingo missiles were used. Satellite images show possible damage at the target site, but independent confirmation and detailed damage assessments are lacking. The Flamingo missile's long range could enable Ukraine to strike deep into Russian territory, posing a significant challenge to Russian military-industrial facilities. The missile is believed to be a Ukrainian variant of the Emirati FP-5 missile, capable of cruising at speeds up to 900 km/h and flying for up to four hours. Production capacity and quantity of these missiles remain unknown.

items.summary_title: Russia attacked Ukraine at night with 150 Shaheds and drone imitators: Air Defense neutralized 120 drones — Air Forces
items.summary: On the night of September 1, Russia launched an attack on Ukraine using 150 Shahed attack drones and various drone imitators. Ukraine's Air Defense forces successfully neutralized 120 of these drones, while 30 drones struck targets across nine locations. The drones were launched from Russian cities including Kursk, Bryansk, Millerovo, Primorsko-Akhtarsk, and from Cape Chauda in temporarily occupied Crimea. The Ukrainian response involved aviation, anti-aircraft missile troops, electronic warfare units, drone systems, and mobile fire groups of the Defense Forces.

items.summary_title: A landslide in Sudan destroyed an entire village, killing at least 1,000 people.
items.summary: A landslide on August 31 in the Marra Mountains area of western Sudan destroyed an entire village, killing at least 1,000 people, with only one survivor reported. The tragedy followed several days of heavy rain. The affected village was completely leveled. The Sudan People's Liberation Army, which controls the Darfur region where the disaster occurred, has appealed to the United Nations and international humanitarian organizations for assistance in recovering the victims' bodies. The region is affected by ongoing conflict between the Sudanese army and paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, causing widespread displacement, food shortages, and insecurity. Over half the population faces hunger due to a two-year civil war, and the capital of North Darfur, El Fasher, remains under constant shelling.

items.summary_title: Ukrainian soldiers have liberated Novoekonomichne in the Donetsk region from Russian forces (video).
items.summary: Ukrainian forces have liberated the village of Novoekonomichne in the Donetsk region from Russian occupation. On August 31, soldiers from the 425th Separate Assault Regiment "Skelya" entered the settlement and raised the Ukrainian flag. The operation took about two weeks and was part of ongoing efforts to regain control over temporarily occupied areas in Donetsk. Previously, Russian forces had occupied Komyshuvakha and advanced near Maliivka and Novoukrainka.

items.summary_title: Slovak PM says he will meet Zelenskyy after talks with Putin in China
items.summary: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico announced he will meet Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on September 5 in eastern Slovakia, following his return from China where he is scheduled to hold talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin. Fico criticized EU countries for largely boycotting the WWII anniversary celebrations in China, emphasizing the importance of engaging in dialogue amid shifting global power dynamics. His foreign minister also discussed the trip with EU diplomatic chief. Meanwhile, no concrete agreements have been reached yet on advancing Russia-Ukraine negotiations, and Ukrainian sources say a direct meeting between Zelenskyy and Putin is unlikely without increased US pressure on Russia.

items.summary_title: Russia attacks Ukraine with 150 drones, hit recorded in 9 locations
items.summary: Between July and August 2025, Ukrainian forces conducted multiple strikes on Russian facilities involved in producing, storing, and transporting Shahed kamikaze drones, significantly reducing Russian drone attacks. Key attacks included destruction of workshops at the Izhevsk Electromechanical Plant, strikes on a warhead factory in Moscow Region, a chemical plant in Krasnozavodsk, a storage hub in Tatarstan, and sinking an Iranian ship carrying drone parts at the Olya seaport. These operations led to a one-third drop in Shahed drone launches against Ukraine, from 6,303 in July to 4,132 in August. Analysts attribute the decline to disrupted Russian drone stockpiles and production. In response, Russia is building new drone launch sites and expanding production efforts.
